About.name: University of Chichester
About.about: The University of Chichester is known as a thriving higher education institution with a rich history tracing back to 1839. We are based on the sunny south coast, just over an hour from London. We have two campuses surrounded by stunning Blue Flag beaches, rolling countryside and a historic city. Here are a few facts and figures to help you get to know us a bit better.
About.whatMakesUsDifferent:
Here at Chichester, we really do have something special. Our students, lecturers and staff consistently say that they love our warm, friendly community.
Being a smaller institution, we have the power to provide you with a great university experience. We have some of the highest satisfaction levels across teaching and student experience. We've been ranked in the Top 30 UK universities by the Guardian University Guide 2025 and received a gold award for teaching excellence by TEF 2023.
We care about your education and your life at university. We want to see you succeed and together, we can help you achieve your goals.

Stats.heading: Stats
Stats.description: Statistics and reviews are supplied by trusted partners and are independent to UCAS. You should also consider attending an open day and talking to staff and students.

StudentLife.heading: Student life
studentLifeParagraphs: Going to university is about more than earning your degree. During your studies you'll meet new people, try new experiences and make memories that stay with you for life.

The University of Chichester offers a student life that can be personalised to your own interests. It’s easy to immerse yourself in exciting opportunities and experiences at university, across Chichester, Bognor Regis, and along the South Coast.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in South East?Check out our region guide
paragraphs: South East England is made up of nine counties, with popular student cities in Brighton & Hove, Oxford, Portsmouth, Reading, and Southampton.
The area sees plenty of sunshine and Brighton – the LGBTQ+ capital of the UK – is a student favourite, with tons of quirky shops, cafes, arts, nightlife and watersports.

Moving east into Kent, you'll find the charming towns of Whitstable, Broadstairs, and Margate – all bursting with literary history – plus the iconic landmarks of Dover’s white cliffs and Canterbury Cathedral.

London is an hour or two away for gigs, theatre trips and capital city adventures, while the country’s two largest airports – Heathrow and Gatwick – mean international journeys are easy to get started.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in Chichester?Check out our city guide
paragraphs: Thinking of studying in Chichester? Enjoy a picturesque cathedral city with coastal charm, cultural richness, and a strong student community.

campusParagraphs: Our campuses are based in the city of Chichester and the nearby coastal resort of Bognor Regis. Both have plenty of relaxing green spaces and a combination of attractive, historic buildings and excellent modern facilities. Bognor Regis is home to the Tech Park which was opened by The Duke and Duchess of Sussex and is home to our STEM and Creative Industries courses.
Choosing accommodation can be daunting, but we're here to guide you through the different types available, enabling you to make an informed decision.

Our accommodation options range from on-campus halls of residence on both our Bishop Otter (Chichester) and Bognor Regis campuses, to our Student Villages situated to the south of the picturesque city centre of Chichester. Choose between ensuite and shared style (i.e. with communal bathrooms and kitchens) accommodation, with catered or self-catered packages allocated on a single occupancy basis.

Courses.heading: Courses
paragraphs: Now, the fun part... finding your perfect degree!

There's much to consider when following your passion and choosing a course. At Chichester, you can gain more by being part of smaller class sizes and having extra time with our expert teaching staff, who will get to know you and your future ambitions.

Many of our degrees are designed with the real world in mind. Benefit from our purpose-built facilities and equipment. You'll gain practical experience to back up the theory so you'll be confident to start your career after your degree.
Discover our dynamic and exciting courses or book an Open Day to learn more, see our facilities and meet the lecturers.

Apprenticeships.heading: Apprenticeships
paragraphs: Boost your career with academic learning alongside on-the-job training.
Degree apprenticeships give you the chance to study and work alongside one another. The advantages are you'll gain real-world experience, a degree and graduate without tuition fee debt.
Want to learn more? Browse our degree apprenticeships.

International.heading: International
paragraphs: At the University of Chichester, we’re pleased to accept qualifications from all over the world for undergraduate and postgraduate entry, as well as for our International Foundation and Pre-Masters programmes.
Why Chichester?

We recognise that diversity is key to creating an enriching academic community. Our international students are at the heart of this, contributing unique perspectives and experiences that improve the learning experience for everyone.
With a longstanding history of supporting international students, we have a deep understanding of the unique challenges faced by those studying away from their home countries and cultures.
This insight allows us to provide tailored support, ensuring that every student has the resources they need to thrive both academically and personally.
Our International Courses
All our programmes are designed with international students in mind.
We also offer a range of specialised courses and services aimed at helping these learners adjust and excel.

These include Pre-Sessional Programmes, which focus on developing students’ academic language and study skills, and International Top-Up Degrees, specially designed one-year full-time programmes for those who hold HND or associate overseas degrees.
By placing the needs of our international students at the forefront, we ensure that they not only succeed in their studies but also feel valued and supported throughout their time with us.

StudentSupport.heading: Student support
paragraphs: We have an outstanding reputation for student satisfaction and retention, and one of the key underlying factors is the excellence of our support services.
